abstract: The owners of Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village, the complexes overlooking the East River in Manhattan, will miss a $16 million loan payment Friday, which would put them in default on their mortgages, and the 20,000 residents in limbo, The New York Times reported.
snippet: The owners of Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village, the complexes overlooking the East River in Manhattan, will miss a $16 million loan payment Friday, which would put them in default on their mortgages, and the 20,000 residents in limbo, The ...
lead_paragraph: The owners of Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village, the sprawling sister complexes overlooking the East River in Manhattan, will miss a $16 million loan payment on Friday, which would put them in technical default on their mortgages, and the 20,000 residents in limbo, The New York Times’s Charles V. Bagli reported.

headline.main: Partners Near Default on Stuyvesant Town
